p:
Disease transmission and case fatality rate (2.3%)
12 are known to be lower in health systems with better systematic pandemic preparedness strategies
13 and experience in managing coronavirus outbreaks. As of March 25, 2020, Singapore has hospitalized 631 COVID-19 cases confirmed by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), 3 of which were pregnant. Of these 631 patients, 160 fully recovered from the infection and were discharged from hospital. There were 2 mortalities from complications owing to COVID-19, 1 of which was an imported patient who was ill before coming to Singapore and admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) upon arrival.
14 Singapore was taken by surprise during the 2003 SARS epidemic, but it has since built capacity and capability within the country to manage global infectious disease emergencies with standard protocols for nongravid and pregnant patients.
